verses.verse: For <WH113>, behold, the Lord, the Lord <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635>, does take away <WH5493> from Jerusalem <WH3389> and from Judah <WH3063> the supply <WH4937> and the staff <WH4938>, the whole supply <WH4937> of bread <WH3899>, and the whole <WH3605> supply <WH4937> of water <WH4325>,
The mighty man <WH1368>, and the man <WH376> of war <WH4421>, the judge <WH8199>, and the prophet <WH5030>, and the prudent <WH7080>, and the ancient <WH2205>,
The captain <WH8269> of fifty <WH2572>, and the honorable <WH5375> man <WH6440>, and the counselor <WH3289>, and the skillful <WH2450> artificer <WH2791>, and the eloquent <WH995> orator <WH3908>.
And I will give <WH5414> sons <WH5288> to be their princes <WH8269>, and babes <WH8586> shall rule over them <WH4910>.

And the people <WH5971> shall be oppressed <WH5065>, every one <WH376> by another <WH376>, and every one <WH376> by his neighbor <WH7453>: the child <WH5288> shall behave himself proudly <WH7292> against the ancient <WH2205>, and the base <WH7034> against the honorable <WH3513>.

When a man <WH376> shall take hold <WH8610> of his brother <WH251> of the house <WH1004> of his father <WH1>, saying <WH8071>, You have clothing, be you our ruler <WH7101>, and let this ruin <WH4384> be under your hand <WH3027>:

In that day <WH3117> shall he swear <WH5375>, saying <WH559>, I will not be a healer <WH2280>; for in my house <WH1004> is neither bread <WH3899> nor clothing <WH8071>: make <WH7760> me not a ruler <WH7101> of the people <WH5971>.

For Jerusalem <WH3389> is ruined <WH3782>, and Judah <WH3063> is fallen <WH5307>: because their tongue <WH3956> and their doings <WH4611> are against the Lord <WH3068>, to provoke <WH4784> the eyes <WH5869> of his glory <WH3519>.

The show <WH1971> of their favor <WH6440> does witness against them <WH6030>; and they declare <WH5046> their sin <WH2403> as Sodom <WH5467>, they hide <WH3582> it not <WH188>. Woe unto their soul <WH5315>! for they have rewarded <WH1580> evil unto themselves <WH7451>.
Say <WH559> you to the righteous <WH6662>, that it shall be well <WH2896> with him <WH398>: for they shall eat the fruit <WH6529> of their doings <WH4611>.
Woe <WH188> unto the wicked <WH7563>! it shall be ill <WH7451> with him <WH1576>: for the doing of his hands <WH3027> shall be done to him <WH6213>.

As for my people <WH5971>, sons <WH5953> are their oppressors <WH5065>, and women <WH802> rule <WH4910> over them <WH5971>. O my people, they which lead <WH833> you cause you to err <WH8582>, and destroy <WH1104> the way <WH1870> of your paths <WH734>.
The Lord <WH3068> stands up <WH5324> to plead <WH7378>, and stands <WH5975> to judge <WH1777> the people <WH5971>.

The Lord <WH3068> will enter <WH935> into judgment <WH4941> with the ancients <WH2205> of his people <WH5971>, and the princes <WH8269> there <WH1197>: for you have eaten up the vineyard <WH3754>; the plunder <WH1500> of the poor <WH6041> is in your houses <WH1004>.

What do you mean that you beat <WH1792> my people <WH5971> to pieces <WH1792>, and grind <WH2912> the faces <WH6440> of the poor <WH6041>? says <WH5002> the Lord <WH136> God <WH3069> of hosts <WH6635>.

Moreover the Lord <WH3068> says <WH559>, Because <WH3282> the daughters <WH1323> of Zion <WH6726> are haughty <WH1361>, and walk <WH3212> with stretched forth <WH5186> necks <WH1627> and wanton <WH8265> eyes <WH5869>, walking <WH1980> and mincing <WH2952> as they go <WH3212>, and making a tinkling <WH5913> with their feet <WH7272>:

Therefore the Lord <WH136> will strike with a scab <WH5596> the crown of the head <WH6936> of the daughters <WH1323> of Zion <WH6726>, and the Lord <WH3068> will discover <WH6168> their secret parts <WH6596>.

In that day <WH3117> the Lord <WH136> will take away <WH5493> the beauty <WH8597> of their tinkling ornaments <WH5914> about their feet <WH7636>, and their hairnets, and their round necklaces like the moon <WH7720>,
The pendants <WH5188>, and the bracelets <WH8285>, and the veils <WH7479>,
The bonnets <WH6287>, and the chains of the ankles <WH6807>, and the headbands <WH7196>, and the perfumes <WH5315>, and the earrings <WH3908>,
The rings <WH2885>, and nose <WH639> jewels <WH5141>,
The changeable suits of apparel <WH4254>, and the capes <WH4595>, and the wide cloaks <WH4304>, and the handbags <WH2754>,
The mirrors <WH1549>, and the fine linen <WH5466>, and the tiaras <WH6797>, and the veils <WH7289>.

And it shall come to pass <WH1314>, that instead of sweet smell, there shall be stink <WH4716>; and instead of a belt <WH2290>, a rope <WH5364>; and instead of well set <WH4639> hair <WH4748>, baldness <WH7144>; and instead of a robe <WH6614>, a girding <WH4228> of sackcloth <WH8242>; and burning <WH3587> instead of beauty <WH3308>.
Your men <WH4962> shall fall <WH5307> by the sword <WH2719>, and your mighty <WH1369> in the war <WH4421>.
And her gates <WH6607> shall lament <WH578> and mourn <WH56>; and she being desolate <WH5352> shall sit <WH3427> upon the ground <WH776>.
